newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: TEN CARS HIJACKED A DAY IN S.AFRICA'S CRIME CAPITAL.
newsitem.headline: TEN CARS HIJACKED A DAY IN S.AFRICA'S CRIME CAPITAL.

text.p: About 10 cars are hijacked at gunpoint each day in South Africa's crime capital Johannesburg, but fewer drivers are being shot dead, latest figures showed on Sunday.

The National Crime Information Centre said that in the first half of the year, an average of 21 cars a day were hijacked in Gauteng province, home to the conurbation linking Soweto, Pretoria and Johannesburg.
The total was marginally down on the first six months of last year. Half of the incidents were in Johannesburg.
"The terrifying aspect of hijack statistics is that in 94 percent of the incidents, firearms were used, leading to 18 deaths and 43 injuries," said the Sunday Times.
"The comparison for last year was 43 people dead and 87 wounded."
The newspaper said the high levels of violent crime in South Africa were having a serious negative effect on potential foreign investment in the country.
According to a Nissan survey, police said there was evidence of collusion by the driver in 90 percent of truck hijackings.
